svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Poverty headcount rate vs. poverty gap, 2014
The extreme poverty rate is defined as the share of people living below the International Poverty Line ($1.90 a day
in 2011 PPP). The extreme poverty gap is the mean shortfall in income or consumption from the same poverty line,
counting the non-poor as having zero shortfall, expressed as a percentage of the poverty line. Consumption or
income measures are adjusted for inflation over time and for price differences between countries (PPP adjustment)
